physical_appearance: This is a typed letter. The top of the letter has a red letterhead, with an emblem and words 'BUCKINGHAM PALACE' printed on it. The letter is printed in black ink. There is date at the bottom-left of the letter. There is a signature in black ink on the bottom-right of the letter. The letter has a small fold on the lower-left corner. There are no tears seen.
sgcool_label_text: A letter issued to ex-prisoners of war of the Japanese, in which George VI welcomes them home, expressing sympathy for their “heavy… suffering” at the hands of the Japanese and wishes them and their families “a full measure of happiness”. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
